content.text:
In popular fiction, the answer to "the meaning of life, the universe and everything" is famously "42" - a reference from Douglas Adams' "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy." In this science fiction comedy series, a supercomputer called Deep Thought spends 7.5 million years calculating this answer, only to reveal that "42" is meaningless because no one knew what the actual question was.

This absurdist response has become one of the most recognizable jokes in science fiction, symbolizing how the biggest philosophical questions might have surprisingly simple (yet unhelpful) answers, or suggesting that we might be asking the wrong questions altogether.

The "42" reference has permeated popular culture and appears in numerous Easter eggs across books, movies, TV shows, and video games as an inside joke for fans.
